caption.p: Ae. aegypti ( left) and Ae. albopictus ( right) adult mosquitoes. Morphologically, both are dark in color with white strips on their backs and legs. However, Ae. albopictus is smaller, with a single, longitudinal, silvery dorsal stripe, while Ae. aegypti has a silvery, lyre-shaped dorsal pattern on its scutum (photo, Anders Lindstr√∂m).
